attributes.action: Removal of appeals system for asylum seekers
attributes.additional_details:
I request that the Foreign Office forward a bill to the House Of Commons for debate on the removal of the Appeals System for Asylum Seekers The Government is struggling to find extra savings and this one is a certain saver. Once an Asylum Seeker enters the Country, makes their request and is denied, then they should be removed immediately. No ifs or buts, just out.
This amendment will not only save billions in costs, but dramatically slow down the overcrowding that is occurring in the UK thanks to to the ignorance of successive governments.
